snippet: Toppling a dictator is only the first step in establishing a free society; the next step is dismantling the dictatorship itself.
abstract: Op-Ed article by economist George B N Ayittey reflects on the nature of failed revolutions in light of the military coup in Mali; notes vast majority of uprisings in Africa, which has experienced more revolutions than any other continent, were unsuccessful; contends toppling a dictator does not ensure victory; holds next step must be dismantling the dictatorship itself.
lead_paragraph: Toppling a dictator is only the first step in establishing a free society; the next step is dismantling the dictatorship itself.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
